questions.question: 2. If  SCR-T<sub>2</sub> is not conducting even with the gate pulses what will be the effect on output voltage?

answers.b: Output voltage will be controlled in positive half cycle but it will be zero in negative half cycle.
answers.c: Output voltage will be controlled in negative half cycle but it will be zero in positive half cycle.
answers.d: SCR-T<sub>1</sub> will operate in both positive and negative half cycles.

explanations.b: Explanation 2: For the negative half cycle SCR-T<sub></sub>1 will be reverse biased and SCR-T<sub></sub>2 is not conducting hence output voltage will be zero in negative half cycle.

questions.question: 3. An isolation transformer with turns ratio 2:1 is used instead of 1:1. What will be the relation between the source current (I<sub>S</sub>) and load current (I<sub>0</sub>).

explanations.b: Explanation 2: For ideal AC voltage controller I<sub>in</sub> = I<sub>0</sub> and voltage step down transformer will step-up the current. Therefore, the relationship is: I<sub>0</sub> = 2I<sub>S</sub>

questions.question: 4. Maximum voltage (V<sub>max</sub>) across SCR at firing angle 30 degree and 150 degree will be (V<sub>m</sub> is the peak source voltage)

answers.a: Vmax (at 30 degree) = V<sub>m</sub>,                 V<sub>max</sub> (at 150 degree) = V<sub>m</sub>
answers.b: Vmax (at 30 degree) = V<sub>m</sub> sin(30 degree),        V<sub>max</sub> (at 150 degree) = V<sub>m</sub> sin(150 degree)
answers.c: Vmax (at 30 degree) = V<sub>m</sub> sin(30 degree),        V<sub>max</sub> (at 150 degree) = V<sub>m</sub>
answers.d: Vmax (at 30 degree) = V<sub>m</sub>,                 V<sub>max</sub> (at 150 degree) = V<sub>m</sub>sin(150 degree)

explanations.c: Explanation 3: At firing angle = 30° SCR starts conducting and hence maximum voltage across it will be V<sub>m</sub> sin(30°). At firing angles = 150° maximum voltage across SCR will be V<sub>m</sub>.

questions.question: 5. What should be the relation between firing angle (α), extinction angle (β) and conduction angle (γ) for non-zero output current?

explanations.d: Explanation 4: SCR starts conducting from the time instant of firing pulse ('α') and stops conducting when current through inductive load becomes zero at extinction angle (β).
